column2: But warn them of the Day of Distress, when the matter will be determined: for (behold,) they are negligent and they do not believe!
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.
column3: And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.

column2: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.
column3: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.

column2: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?
column3: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God hath done unto us?

column2: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.
column3: Behold, the LORD thy God hath set the land before thee: go up and possess it, as the LORD God of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.

column2: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: For the LORD thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God.

column2: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
column3: And I say unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.

column2: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
column3: And he said O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray thee, send me good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master Abraham.

column2: "And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest."
column3: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.

column2: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.
column3: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

column2: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
column3: And this is the blessing, wherewith Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.

column2: And we called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai), and made him draw near to Us, for mystic (converse).
column3: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan by Jericho.

column2: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.
column3: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.

column2: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
column3: This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them.

column2: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
column3: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the LORD's offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.

column2: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:
column3: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.

column2: And We raised him to a lofty station.
column3: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.

column2: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Gardens of Eternity, those which (Allah) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.
column3: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.

column2: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who guard against Evil.
column3: Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.

column2: (The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to Him belongeth what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between: and thy Lord never doth forget,-
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
column3: And to make thee high above all nations which he hath made, in praise, and in name, and in honor; and that thou mayest be an holy people unto the LORD thy God, as he hath spoken.

column2: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;
column3: Moreover the LORD thy God will send the hornet among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves from thee, be destroyed.

column2: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.

column2: And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being burned therein.
column3: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord's bondmen.

column2: Not one of you but will pass over it: this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which must be accomplished.
column3: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to morrow shall this sign be.

column2: But We shall save those who guarded against evil, and We shall leave the wrong-doers therein, (humbled) to their knees.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, the Unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two sides is best in point of position? Which makes the best show in council?"
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
column3: Even those that were numbered of them after their families, were three thousand and two hundred.

column2: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: "And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."
column3: And the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they be thy due, and thy sons' due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.

column2: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.
column3: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to morrow shall this sign be.

column2: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.
column3: The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee; and shall say, Destroy them.

column2: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!
column3: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;

column2: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
column3: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:

column2: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
column3: And, behold, ye are risen up in your fathers' stead, an increase of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.

column2: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).
column3: After the number of the days in which ye searched the land, even forty days, each day for a year, shall ye bear your iniquities, even forty years, and ye shall know my breach of promise.

column2: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
column3: And he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and burn him as he burned the first bullock: it is a sin offering for the congregation.

column2: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the LORD be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

column2: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
column3: Because I will publish the name of the LORD: ascribe ye greatness unto our God.

column2: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
column3: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

column2: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
column3: And I will scatter you among the heathen, and will draw out a sword after you: and your land shall be desolate, and your cities waste.

column2: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
column3: Because I will publish the name of the LORD: ascribe ye greatness unto our God.

column2: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

column2: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
column3: And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the LORD be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

column2: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.
column3: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel: and this is it that their father spake unto them, and blessed them; every one according to his blessing he blessed them.

column2: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.
column3: Three items in the year all thy males shall appear before the LORD God.

column2: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
column3: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?

column2: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?
column3: For I know thy rebellion, and thy stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, ye have been rebellious against the LORD; and how much more after my death?

column2: Ta-Ha.
column3: And Leah said, A troop cometh: and she called his name Gad.

column2: We have not sent down the Qur'an to thee to be (an occasion) for thy distress,
column3: If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

column2: But only as an admonition to those who fear (Allah),-
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.
column3: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

column2: (Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of authority).
column3: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

column2: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, and all between them, and all beneath the soil.
column3: Namely, of the gods of the people which are round about you, nigh unto thee, or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth;

column2: If thou pronounce the word aloud, (it is no matter): for verily He knoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden.
column3: When a prophet speaketh in the name of the LORD, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.

column2: Allah! there is no god but He! To Him belong the most Beautiful Names.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
column3: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.

column2: Behold, he saw a fire: So he said to his family, "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire."
column3: And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that ye shall pass on: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And they said, So do, as thou hast said.

column2: But when he came to the fire, a voice was heard: "O Moses!
column3: And it came to pass, when the congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron, that they looked toward the tabernacle of the congregation: and, behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of the LORD appeared.

column2: "Verily I am thy Lord! therefore (in My presence) put off thy shoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa.
column3: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.

column2: "I have chosen thee: listen, then, to the inspiration (sent to thee).
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: "Verily, I am Allah: There is no god but I: So serve thou Me (only), and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
column3: Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

column2: "Verily the Hour is coming - My design is to keep it hidden - for every soul to receive its reward by the measure of its Endeavour.
column3: Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.

column2: "Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their own lusts, divert thee therefrom, lest thou perish!"..
column3: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

column2: "And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"
column3: And when it rested, he said, Return, O LORD, unto the many thousands of Israel.

column2: He said, "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder for my flocks; and in it I find other uses."
column3: See now that I, even I, am he, and there is no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: neither is there any that can deliver out of my hand.

column2: (Allah) said, "Throw it, O Moses!"
column3: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!

column2: He threw it, and behold! It was a snake, active in motion.
column3: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

column2: (Allah) said, "Seize it, and fear not: We shall return it at once to its former condition"..
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: "Now draw thy hand close to thy side: It shall come forth white (and shining), without harm (or stain),- as another Sign,-
column3: Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;

column2: "In order that We may show thee (two) of our Greater Signs.
column3: And the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave offering of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.

column2: "Go thou to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds."
column3: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.

column2: (Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;
column3: And Joseph said unto them the third day, This do, and live; for I fear God:

column2: "Ease my task for me;
column3: This do; Take you censers, Korah, and all his company;

column2: "And remove the impediment from my speech,
column3: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.

column2: "So they may understand what I say:
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: "And give me a Minister from my family,
column3: And one kid of the goats, to make an atonement for you.

column2: "Aaron, my brother;
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: "Add to my strength through him,
column3: Every raven after his kind;

column2: "And make him share my task:
column3: And one goat for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you.

column2: "That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint,
column3: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

column2: "And remember Thee without stint:
column3: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.

column2: "For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us."
column3: And the Levite that is within thy gates; thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.

column2: (Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer, O Moses!"
column3: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!

column2: "And indeed We conferred a favour on thee another time (before).
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: "Behold! We sent to thy mother, by inspiration, the message:
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.
column3: His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt in any wise bury him that day; (for he that is hanged is accursed of God;) that thy land be not defiled, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

column2: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, 'shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man, but We saved thee from trouble, and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained, O Moses!
column3: And thou shalt say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.

column2: "And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)"..
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: "Go, thou and thy brother, with My Signs, and slacken not, either of you, in keeping Me in remembrance.
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: "Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds;
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: "But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear (Allah)."
column3: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.

column2: They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! We fear lest he hasten with insolence against us, or lest he transgress all bounds."
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see (everything).
column3: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.

column2: "So go ye both to him, and say, 'Verily we are messengers sent by thy Lord: Send forth, therefore, the Children of Israel with us, and afflict them not: with a Sign, indeed, have we come from thy Lord! and peace to all who follow guidance!
column3: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.

column2: "'Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits) those who reject and turn away.'"
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"
column3: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

column2: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its form and nature, and further, gave (it) guidance."
column3: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"
column3: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.

column2: He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord, duly recorded: my Lord never errs, nor forgets,-
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: "He Who has, made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has sent down water from the sky." With it have We produced diverse pairs of plants each separate from the others.
column3: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

column2: Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
column3: And the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering shalt thou prepare with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for one lamb.

column2: From the (earth) did We create you, and into it shall We return you, and from it shall We bring you out once again.
column3: And I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, which bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.

column2: And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs, but he did reject and refuse.
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy magic, O Moses?
column3: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.

column2: "But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor thou - in a place where both shall have even chances."
column3: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.

column2: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up."
column3: And be ready against the third day: for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.

column2: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).
column3: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.

column2: Moses said to him: Woe to you! Forge not ye a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger must suffer frustration!"
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

column2: So they disputed, one with another, over their affair, but they kept their talk secret.
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their object is to drive you out from your land with their magic, and to do away with your most cherished institutions.
column3: Then ye shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, and destroy all their pictures, and destroy all their molten images, and quite pluck down all their high places:

column2: "Therefore concert your plan, and then assemble in (serried) ranks: He wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."
column3: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

column2: They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or that we be the first to throw?"
column3: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.

column2: He said, "Nay, throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their rods-so it seemed to him on account of their magic - began to be in lively motion!
column3: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;

column2: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
column3: And Moab was sore afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

column2: We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:
column3: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.

column2: "Throw that which is in thy right hand: Quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked what they have faked is but a magician's trick: and the magician thrives not, (no matter) where he goes."
column3: And the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his color, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without.

column2: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".
column3: That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the LORD's passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear Signs that have come to us, or than Him Who created us! so decree whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree (touching) the life of this world.
column3: For these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearkened unto observers of times, and unto diviners: but as for thee, the LORD thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.

column2: "For us, we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults, and the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best and Most Abiding."
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

column2: Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at Judgment),- for him is Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live.
column3: His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt in any wise bury him that day; (for he that is hanged is accursed of God;) that thy land be not defiled, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

column2: But such as come to Him as Believers who have worked righteous deeds,- for them are ranks exalted,-
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell therein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify themselves (from evil).
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear."
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

column2: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces, but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
column3: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.

column2: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
column3: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.

column2: O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a Covenant with you on the right side of Mount (Sinai), and We sent down to you Manna and quails:
column3: And I, behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are given as a gift for the LORD, to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

column2: (Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your sustenance, but commit no excess therein, lest My Wrath should justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do perish indeed!
column3: I also will do this unto you; I will even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burning ague, that shall consume the eyes, and cause sorrow of heart: and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.

column2: "But, without doubt, I am (also) He that forgives again and again, to those who repent, believe, and do right, who,- in fine, are ready to receive true guidance."
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"
column3: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!

column2: He replied: "Behold, they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to thee, O my Lord, to please thee."
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: (Allah) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the Samiri has led them astray."
column3: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the LORD, therefore the LORD will not be with you.

column2: So Moses returned to his people in a state of indignation and sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your Lord on you, and so ye broke your promise to me?"
column3: And Moses besought the LORD his God, and said, LORD, why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power, and with a mighty hand?

column2: They said: "We broke not the promise to thee, as far as lay in our power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the (whole) people, and we threw them (into the fire), and that was what the Samiri suggested.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"
column3: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

column2: Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for answer), and that it had no power either to harm them or to do them good?
column3: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?

column2: Aaron had already, before this said to them: "O my people! ye are being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (Allah) Most Gracious; so follow me and obey my command."
column3: And Jacob said unto his father, I am Esau thy first born; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.

column2: They had said: "We will not abandon this cult, but we will devote ourselves to it until Moses returns to us."
column3: We will go three days' journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God, as he shall command us.

column2: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,
column3: And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?

column2: "From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"
column3: And Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honor?

column2: (Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say, 'Thou has caused a division among the children of Israel, and thou didst not respect my word!'"
column3: And thou shalt say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.

column2: (Moses) said: "What then is thy case, O Samiri?"
column3: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the LORD? but it shall not prosper.

column2: He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of dust) from the footprint of the Messenger, and threw it (into the calf): thus did my soul suggest to me."
column3: And I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, and ground it very small, even until it was as small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.

column2: (Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life will be that thou wilt say, 'touch me not'; and moreover (for a future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: Now look at thy god, of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: We will certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in the sea!"
column3: When thou shalt besiege a city a long time, in making war against it to take it, thou shalt not destroy the trees thereof by forcing an axe against them: for thou mayest eat of them, and thou shalt not cut them down (for the tree of the field is man's life) to employ them in the siege:

column2: But the god of you all is the One Allah: there is no god but He: all things He comprehends in His knowledge.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before: for We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.
column3: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.

column2: If any do turn away therefrom, verily they will bear a burden on the Day of judgment;
column3: To me belongeth vengeance and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

column2: They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be to them on that Day,-
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day, We shall gather the sinful, blear-eyed (with terror).
column3: And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.

column2: In whispers will they consult each other: "Yet tarried not longer than ten (Days);
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: We know best what they will say, when their leader most eminent in conduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: They ask thee concerning the Mountains: say, "My Lord will uproot them and scatter them as dust;
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: "He will leave them as plains smooth and level;
column3: But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;

column2: "Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place."
column3: And look that thou make them after their pattern, which was showed thee in the mount.

column2: On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble themselves in the Presence of (Allah) Most Gracious: nothing shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march).
column3: Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant: and I will lead on softly, according as the cattle that goeth before me and the children be able to endure, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.

column2: On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom permission has been granted by (Allah) Most Gracious and whose word is acceptable to Him.
column3: And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the LORD be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

column2: He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or behind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: (All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) - the Living, the Self-Subsisting, Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that carries iniquity (on his back).
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: But he who works deeds of righteousness, and has faith, will have no fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).
column3: When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;

column2: Thus have We sent this down - an arabic Qur'an - and explained therein in detail some of the warnings, in order that they may fear Allah, or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him).
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: High above all is Allah, the King, the Truth! Be not in haste with the Qur'an before its revelation to thee is completed, but say, "O my Lord! advance me in knowledge."
column3: According to all that thou desiredst of the LORD thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.

column2: We had already, beforehand, taken the covenant of Adam, but he forgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve.
column3: But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,

column2: When We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves to Adam", they prostrated themselves, but not Iblis: he refused.
column3: When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the LORD commanded Moses.

column2: Then We said: "O Adam! verily, this is an enemy to thee and thy wife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden, so that thou art landed in misery.
column3: Now therefore restore the man his wife; for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.

column2: "There is therein (enough provision) for thee not to go hungry nor to go naked,
column3: That which dieth of itself, or is torn with beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith; I am the LORD.

column2: "Nor to suffer from thirst, nor from the sun's heat."
column3: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

column2: But Satan whispered evil to him: he said, "O Adam! shall I lead thee to the Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"
column3: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!

column2: In the result, they both ate of the tree, and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together, for their covering, leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey his Lord, and allow himself to be seduced.
column3: He slew also the bullock and the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings, which was for the people: and Aaron's sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled upon the altar round about,

column2: But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him, and gave him Guidance.
column3: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

column2: He said: "Get ye down, both of you,- all together, from the Garden, with enmity one to another: but if, as is sure, there comes to you Guidance from Me, whosoever follows My Guidance, will not lose his way, nor fall into misery.
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: "But whosoever turns away from My Message, verily for him is a life narrowed down, and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of Judgment."
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: He will say: "O my Lord! why hast Thou raised me up blind, while I had sight (before)?"
column3: And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.

column2: (Allah) will say: "Thus didst Thou, when Our Signs came unto thee, disregard them: so wilt thou, this day, be disregarded."
column3: Therefore now go, lead the people unto the place of which I have spoken unto thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee: nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.

column2: And thus do We recompense him who transgresses beyond bounds and believes not in the Signs of his Lord: and the Penalty of the Hereafter is far more grievous and more enduring.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Is it not a warning to such men (to call to mind) how many generations before them We destroyed, in whose haunts they (now) move? Verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
column3: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.

column2: Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a Term appointed (for respite).
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Therefore be patient with what they say, and celebrate (constantly) the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun, and before its setting; yea, celebrate them for part of the hours of the night, and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have (spiritual) joy.
column3: Three times in a year shall all thy males appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the LORD empty:

column2: Nor strain thine eyes in longing for the things We have given for enjoyment to parties of them, the splendour of the life of this world, through which We test them: but the provision of thy Lord is better and more enduring.
column3: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.

column2: Enjoin prayer on thy people, and be constant therein. We ask thee not to provide sustenance: We provide it for thee. But the (fruit of) the Hereafter is for righteousness.
column3: Take thou no usury of him, or increase: but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.

column2: They say: "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has not a Clear Sign come to them of all that was in the former Books of revelation?
column3: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.

column2: And if We had inflicted on them a penalty before this, they would have said: "Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent us a messenger, we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame."
column3: Wherefore, said they, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession, and bring us not over Jordan.

column2: Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye, therefore, and soon shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way, and who it is that has received Guidance."
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
column3: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.

column2: Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord, but they listen to it as in jest,-
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Their hearts toying as with trifles. The wrong-doers conceal their private counsels, (saying), "Is this (one) more than a man like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?"
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: "Nay," they say, "(these are) medleys of dream! - Nay, He forged it! - Nay, He is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!"
column3: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:

column2: (As to those) before them, not one of the populations which We destroyed believed: will these believe?
column3: Your carcasses shall fall in this wilderness; and all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward which have murmured against me.

column2: Before thee, also, the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
column3: Behold now, I have two daughters which have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof.

column2: Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they exempt from death.
column3: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

column2: In the end We fulfilled to them Our Promise, and We saved them and those whom We pleased, but We destroyed those who transgressed beyond bounds.
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message for you: will ye not then understand?
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: How many were the populations We utterly destroyed because of their iniquities, setting up in their places other peoples?
column3: Even those that were numbered of them after their families, were three thousand and two hundred.

column2: Yet, when they felt Our Punishment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
column3: And it came to pass, as her soul was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name Benoni: but his father called him Benjamin.

column2: Flee not, but return to the good things of this life which were given you, and to your homes in order that ye may be called to account.
column3: Therefore shall ye keep all the commandments which I command you this day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land, whither ye go to possess it;

column2: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
column3: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.

column2: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
column3: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, what time the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men: and they became a sign.

column2: Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and all that is between!
column3: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;

column2: If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime, We should surely have taken it from the things nearest to Us, if We would do (such a thing)!
column3: Moreover your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, and your children, which in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall possess it.

column2: Nay, We hurl the Truth against falsehood, and it knocks out its brain, and behold, falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the (false) things ye ascribe (to Us).
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: Even those who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they (ever) weary (of His service):
column3: The LORD did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any people; for ye were the fewest of all people:

column2: They celebrate His praises night and day, nor do they ever flag or intermit.
column3: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

column2: Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can raise (the dead)?
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: If there were, in the heavens and the earth, other gods besides Allah, there would have been confusion in both! but glory to Allah, the Lord of the Throne: (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!
column3: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;

column2: He cannot be questioned for His acts, but they will be questioned (for theirs).
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides him? Say, "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not the Truth, and so turn away.
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: Not a messenger did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.
column3: According to all that thou desiredst of the LORD thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.

column2: And they say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten offspring." Glory to Him! they are (but) servants raised to honour.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: They speak not before He speaks, and they act (in all things) by His Command.
column3: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly he was above them.

column2: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable, and they stand in awe and reverence of His (Glory).
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: If any of them should say, "I am a god besides Him", such a one We should reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of creation), before we clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
column3: For who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?

column2: And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with them, and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive Guidance.
column3: Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.

column2: And We have made the heavens as a canopy well guarded: yet do they turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!
column3: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:

column2: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if then thou shouldst die, would they live permanently?
column3: Whosoever cometh any thing near unto the tabernacle of the LORD shall die: shall we be consumed with dying?

column2: Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil and by good by way of trial. to Us must ye return.
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: When the Unbelievers see thee, they treat thee not except with ridicule. "Is this," (they say), "the one who talks of your gods?" and they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious!
column3: And Moses spake before the LORD, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened unto me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?

column2: Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My Signs; then ye will not ask Me to hasten them!
column3: And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.

column2: They say: "When will this promise come to pass, if ye are telling the truth?"
column3: And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.

column2: If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor yet from their backs, and (when) no help can reach them!
column3: For they will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of the LORD be kindled against you, and destroy thee suddenly.

column2: Nay, it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no power will they have then to avert it, nor will they (then) get respite.
column3: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.

column2: Mocked were (many) messenger before thee; But their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: Say: "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath of) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
column3: And those men said unto him, We are defiled by the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not offer an offering of the LORD in his appointed season among the children of Israel?

column2: Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power to aid themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: Nay, We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?
column3: That ye shall say, Thy servants' trade hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.

column2: Say, "I do but warn you according to revelation": But the deaf will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned!
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them, they will then say, "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"
column3: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.

column2: We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least, and if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
column3: So shall my righteousness answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my hire before thy face: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be counted stolen with me.

column2: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-
column3: In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the LORD: it shall be a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.

column2: Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts, and who hold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye then reject it?
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.
column3: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.

column2: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"
column3: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee:

column2: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."
column3: And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

column2: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."
column3: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.

column2: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"
column3: And said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.

column2: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).
column3: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

column2: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.
column3: Get you up from among this congregation, that I may consume them as in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.

column2: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."
column3: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

column2: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
column3: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.

column2: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"
column3: And Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?

column2: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
column3: And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?

column2: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
column3: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?

column2: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..
column3: And a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.

column2: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
column3: And Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto Abimelech; and both of them made a covenant.

column2: And We made them leaders, guiding (men) by Our Command, and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds, to establish regular prayers, and to practise regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only).
column3: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in mortar, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigor.

column2: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.
column3: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

column2: And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the Righteous.
column3: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

column2: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.
column3: That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the LORD's passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.

column2: We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they were a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood) all together.
column3: And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph for to buy corn; because that the famine was so sore in all lands.

column2: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.
column3: That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the LORD's passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.

column2: To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises, with David: it was We Who did (all these things).
column3: And he provided the first part for himself, because there, in a portion of the lawgiver, was he seated; and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the LORD, and his judgments with Israel.

column2: It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your benefit, to guard you from each other's violence: will ye then be grateful?
column3: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?

column2: (It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow (tamely) for Solomon, to his order, to the land which We had blessed: for We do know all things.
column3: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.

column2: And of the evil ones, were some who dived for him, and did other work besides; and it was We Who guarded them.
column3: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.

column2: And (remember) Job, when He cried to his Lord, "Truly distress has seized me, but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: And (remember) Isma'il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;
column3: And the sons of Kohath by their families; Amram, and Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

column2: We admitted them to Our mercy: for they were of the righteous ones.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.
