column2: We have already sent down to you verses making things clear, an illustration from (the story of) people who passed away before you, and an admonition for those who fear (Allah).
column3: And one kid of the goats for a sin offering, to make an atonement for you:

column2: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The Parable of His Light is as if there were a Niche and within it a Lamp: the Lamp enclosed in Glass: the glass as it were a brilliant star: Lit from a blessed Tree, an Olive, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil is well-nigh luminous, though fire scarce touched it: Light upon Light! Allah doth guide whom He will to His Light: Allah doth set forth Parables for men: and Allah doth know all things.
column3: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

column2: (Lit is such a Light) in houses, which Allah hath permitted to be raised to honour; for the celebration, in them, of His name: In them is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings, (again and again),-
column3: And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire unto the LORD; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,

column2: By men whom neither traffic nor merchandise can divert from the Remembrance of Allah, nor from regular Prayer, nor from the practice of regular Charity: Their (only) fear is for the Day when hearts and eyes will be transformed (in a world wholly new),-
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His Grace: for Allah doth provide for those whom He will, without measure.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: But the Unbelievers,- their deeds are like a mirage in sandy deserts, which the man parched with thirst mistakes for water; until when he comes up to it, he finds it to be nothing: But he finds Allah (ever) with him, and Allah will pay him his account: and Allah is swift in taking account.
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Or (the Unbelievers' state) is like the depths of darkness in a vast deep ocean, overwhelmed with billow topped by billow, topped by (dark) clouds: depths of darkness, one above another: if a man stretches out his hands, he can hardly see it! for any to whom Allah giveth not light, there is no light!
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Seest thou not that it is Allah Whose praises all beings in the heavens and on earth do celebrate, and the birds (of the air) with wings outspread? Each one knows its own (mode of) prayer and praise. And Allah knows well all that they do.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Yea, to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; and to Allah is the final goal (of all).
column3: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.

column2: Seest thou not that Allah makes the clouds move gently, then joins them together, then makes them into a heap? - then wilt thou see rain issue forth from their midst. And He sends down from the sky mountain masses (of clouds) wherein is hail: He strikes therewith whom He pleases and He turns it away from whom He pleases, the vivid flash of His lightning well-nigh blinds the sight.
column3: Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river's brink against he come; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand.

column2: It is Allah Who alternates the Night and the Day: verily in these things is an instructive example for those who have vision!
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: And Allah has created every animal from water: of them there are some that creep on their bellies; some that walk on two legs; and some that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills for verily Allah has power over all things.
column3: Yet these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon all four, which have legs above their feet, to leap withal upon the earth;

column2: We have indeed sent down signs that make things manifest: and Allah guides whom He wills to a way that is straight.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: They say, "We believe in Allah and in the messenger, and we obey": but even after that, some of them turn away: they are not (really) Believers.
column3: And the herdmen of Gerar did strive with Isaac's herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.

column2: When they are summoned to Allah and His messenger, in order that He may judge between them, behold some of them decline (to come).
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: But if the right is on their side, they come to him with all submission.
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? or do they doubt, or are they in fear, that Allah and His Messenger will deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is they themselves who do wrong.
column3: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife's sake.

column2: The answer of the Believers, when summoned to Allah and His Messenger, in order that He may judge between them, is no other than this: they say, "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that will attain felicity.
column3: Then said the LORD unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a certain rate every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or no.

column2: It is such as obey Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah and do right, that will win (in the end),
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: They swear their strongest oaths by Allah that, if only thou wouldst command them, they would leave (their homes). Say: "Swear ye not; Obedience is (more) reasonable; verily, Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do."
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Say: "Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger: but if ye turn away, he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that placed on you. If ye obey him, ye shall be on right guidance. The Messenger's duty is only to preach the clear (Message).
column3: And a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the LORD your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.

column2: Allah has promised, to those among you who believe and work righteous deeds, that He will, of a surety, grant them in the land, inheritance (of power), as He granted it to those before them; that He will establish in authority their religion - the one which He has chosen for them; and that He will change (their state), after the fear in which they (lived), to one of security and peace: 'They will worship Me (alone) and not associate aught with Me. 'If any do reject Faith after this, they are rebellious and wicked.
column3: This is the law of the Nazarite who hath vowed, and of his offering unto the LORD for his separation, beside that that his hand shall get: according to the vow which he vowed, so he must do after the law of his separation.

column2: So establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and obey the Messenger; that ye may receive mercy.
column3: And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days:

column2: Never think thou that the Unbelievers are going to frustrate (Allah's Plan) on earth: their abode is the Fire,- and it is indeed an evil refuge!
column3: Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them.

column2: O ye who believe! let those whom your right hands possess, and the (children) among you who have not come of age ask your permission (before they come to your presence), on three occasions: before morning prayer; the while ye doff your clothes for the noonday heat; and after the late-night prayer: these are your three times of undress: outside those times it is not wrong for you or for them to move about attending to each other: Thus does Allah make clear the Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
column3: When they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the LORD:

column2: But when the children among you come of age, let them (also) ask for permission, as do those senior to them (in age): Thus does Allah make clear His Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
column3: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.

column2: Such elderly women as are past the prospect of marriage,- there is no blame on them if they lay aside their (outer) garments, provided they make not a wanton display of their beauty: but it is best for them to be modest: and Allah is One Who sees and knows all things.
column3: Behold now, I have two daughters which have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof.

column2: It is no fault in the blind nor in one born lame, nor in one afflicted with illness, nor in yourselves, that ye should eat in your own houses, or those of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your father's brothers or your father's sisters, or your mother's brothers, or your mother's sisters, or in houses of which the keys are in your possession, or in the house of a sincere friend of yours: there is no blame on you, whether ye eat in company or separately. But if ye enter houses, salute each other - a greeting of blessing and purity as from Allah. Thus does Allah make clear the signs to you: that ye may understand.
column3: If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son, or thy daughter, or the wife of thy bosom, or thy friend, which is as thine own soul, entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou, nor thy fathers;

column2: Only those are believers, who believe in Allah and His Messenger: when they are with him on a matter requiring collective action, they do not depart until they have asked for his leave; those who ask for thy leave are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger; so when they ask for thy leave, for some business of theirs, give leave to those of them whom thou wilt, and ask Allah for their forgiveness: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: Her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination before the LORD: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

column2: Deem not the summons of the Messenger among yourselves like the summons of one of you to another: Allah doth know those of you who slip away under shelter of some excuse: then let those beware who withstand the Messenger's order, lest some trial befall them, or a grievous penalty be inflicted on them.
column3: But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbor, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.

column2: Be quite sure that to Allah doth belong whatever is in the heavens and on earth. Well doth He know what ye are intent upon: and one day they will be brought back to Him, and He will tell them the truth of what they did: for Allah doth know all things.
column3: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

column2: Blessed is He who sent down the criterion to His servant, that it may be an admonition to all creatures;-
column3: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.

column2: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no son has He begotten, nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is He who created all things, and ordered them in due proportions.
column3: And to make thee high above all nations which he hath made, in praise, and in name, and in honor; and that thou mayest be an holy people unto the LORD thy God, as he hath spoken.

column2: Yet have they taken, besides him, gods that can create nothing but are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to themselves; nor can they control death nor life nor resurrection.
column3: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men's hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

column2: But the misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has forged, and others have helped him at it." In truth it is they who have put forward an iniquity and a falsehood.
column3: Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, and lest they should say, Our hand is high, and the LORD hath not done all this.

column2: And they say: "Tales of the ancients, which he has caused to be written: and they are dictated before him morning and evening."
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Say: "The (Qur'an) was sent down by Him who knows the mystery (that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: And they say: "What sort of a messenger is this, who eats food, and walks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to him to give admonition with him?
column3: And those men said unto him, We are defiled by the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not offer an offering of the LORD in his appointed season among the children of Israel?

column2: "Or (Why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him, or why has he (not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none other than a man bewitched."
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: See what kinds of comparisons they make for thee! But they have gone astray, and never a way will they be able to find!
column3: There is no straw given unto thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, thy servants are beaten; but the fault is in thine own people.

column2: Blessed is He who, if that were His will, could give thee better (things) than those,- Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He could give thee palaces (secure to dwell in).
column3: But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.

column2: Nay they deny the hour (of the judgment to come): but We have prepared a blazing fire for such as deny the hour:
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: When it sees them from a place far off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.
column3: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.

column2: And when they are cast, bound together into a constricted place therein, they will plead for destruction there and then!
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: "This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for destruction oft-repeated!"
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: Say: "Is that best, or the eternal garden, promised to the righteous? for them, that is a reward as well as a goal (of attainment).
column3: As the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.

column2: "For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will dwell (there) for aye: A promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: The day He will gather them together as well as those whom they worship besides Allah, He will ask: "Was it ye who let these My servants astray, or did they stray from the Path themselves?"
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides Thee: But Thou didst bestow, on them and their fathers, good things (in life), until they forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost."
column3: Not for thy righteousness, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wickedness of these nations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee, and that he may perform the word which the LORD sware unto thy fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

column2: (Allah will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say: so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help." And whoever among you does wrong, him shall We cause to taste of a grievous Penalty.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: And the messengers whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as a trial for others: will ye have patience? for Allah is One Who sees (all things).
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are not the angels sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves, and mighty is the insolence of their impiety!
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: The Day they see the angels,- no joy will there be to the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden (to you) altogether!"
column3: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.

column2: And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life), and We shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: The Companions of the Garden will be well, that Day, in their abode, and have the fairest of places for repose.
column3: They shall call the people unto the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck of the abundance of the seas, and of treasures hid in the sand.

column2: The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and angels shall be sent down, descending (in ranks),-
column3: And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.

column2: That Day, the dominion as of right and truth, shall be (wholly) for (Allah) Most Merciful: it will be a Day of dire difficulty for the misbelievers.
column3: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.

column2: The Day that the wrong-doer will bite at his hands, he will say, "Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Messenger!
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: "Ah! woe is me! Would that I had never taken such a one for a friend!
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: "He did lead me astray from the Message (of Allah) after it had come to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!"
column3: As the nations which the LORD destroyeth before your face, so shall ye perish; because ye would not be obedient unto the voice of the LORD your God.

column2: Then the Messenger will say: "O my Lord! Truly my people took this Qur'an for just foolish nonsense."
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners: but enough is thy Lord to guide and to help.
column3: Thou shalt not be affrighted at them: for the LORD thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.

column2: Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to him all at once? Thus (is it revealed), that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow, well-arranged stages, gradually.
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the truth and the best explanation (thereof).
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces,- they will be in an evil plight, and, as to Path, most astray.
column3: And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go a whoring after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

column2: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;
column3: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.

column2: And We command: "Go ye both, to the people who have rejected our Signs:" And those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.
column3: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.

column2: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-
column3: And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offering, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD, for their ignorance:

column2: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
column3: And the sons of Pallu; Eliab.

column2: To each one We set forth Parables and examples; and each one We broke to utter annihilation (for their sins).
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection.
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: When they see thee, they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?"
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods, had it not been that we were constant to them!" - Soon will they know, when they see the Penalty, who it is that is most misled in Path!
column3: That the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbor unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:

column2: Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
column3: Because thou servedst not the LORD thy God with joyfulness, and with gladness of heart, for the abundance of all things;

column2: Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle;- nay, they are worse astray in Path.
column3: Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer for a freewill offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.

column2: Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord?- How He doth prolong the shadow! If He willed, He could make it stationary! then do We make the sun its guide;
column3: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because thy way is perverse before me:

column2: Then We draw it in towards Ourselves,- a contraction by easy stages.
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you, and Sleep as Repose, and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.
column3: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.

column2: And He it is Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky,-
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: That with it We may give life to a dead land, and slake the thirst of things We have created,- cattle and men in great numbers.
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: And We have distributed the (water) amongst them, in order that they may celebrate (our) praises, but most men are averse (to aught) but (rank) ingratitude.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: Had it been Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every centre of population.
column3: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.

column2: Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers, but strive against them with the utmost strenuousness, with the (Qur'an).
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: One palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter; yet has He made a barrier between them, a partition that is forbidden to be passed.
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established relationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power (over all things).
column3: Wherefore Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; the LORD is his inheritance, according as the LORD thy God promised him.

column2: Yet do they worship, besides Allah, things that can neither profit them nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord!
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one who will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
column3: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.

column2: And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate his praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of His servants;-
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between, in six days, and is firmly established on the Throne (of Authority): Allah Most Gracious: ask thou, then, about Him of any acquainted (with such things).
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: When it is said to them, "Prostrate to (Allah) Most Gracious!", they say, "And what is (Allah) Most Gracious? Shall we prostrate to that which thou commandest us?" And it increases their flight (from the Truth).
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;
column3: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

column2: And it is He Who made the Night and the Day to follow each other: for such as have the will to celebrate His praises or to show their gratitude.
column3: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.

column2: And the servants of (Allah) Most Gracious are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace!";
column3: And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the LORD;

column2: Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate and standing;
column3: And will make an offering by fire unto the LORD, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or in a freewill offering, or in your solemn feasts, to make a sweet savor unto the LORD, of the herd or of the flock:

column2: Those who say, "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell, for its Wrath is indeed an affliction grievous,-
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the LORD thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.

column2: "Evil indeed is it as an abode, and as a place to rest in";
column3: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

column2: Those who, when they spend, are not extravagant and not niggardly, but hold a just (balance) between those (extremes);
column3: And these are they which ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,

column2: Those who invoke not, with Allah, any other god, nor slay such life as Allah has made sacred except for just cause, nor commit fornication; - and any that does this (not only) meets punishment.
column3: When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;

column2: (But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will dwell therein in ignominy,-
column3: To me belongeth vengeance and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

column2: Unless he repents, believes, and works righteous deeds, for Allah will change the evil of such persons into good, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful,
column3: The LORD is long-suffering, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation.

column2: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with an (acceptable) conversion;-
column3: And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the LORD be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

column2: Those who witness no falsehood, and, if they pass by futility, they pass by it with honourable (avoidance);
column3: But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,

column2: Those who, when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord, droop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind;
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Grant unto us wives and offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous."
column3: Gather the people together, men and women, and children, and thy stranger that is within thy gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear the LORD your God, and observe to do all the words of this law:

column2: Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in heaven, because of their patient constancy: therein shall they be met with salutations and peace,
column3: They shall call the people unto the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck of the abundance of the seas, and of treasures hid in the sand.

column2: Dwelling therein;- how beautiful an abode and place of rest!
column3: But the land, whither ye go to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys, and drinketh water of the rain of heaven:

column2: Say (to the Rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if ye call not on Him: But ye have indeed rejected (Him), and soon will come the inevitable (punishment)!"
column3: But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.

column2: Ta. Sin. Mim.
column3: And the sons of Pallu; Eliab.

column2: These are verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
column3: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

column2: It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief, that they do not become Believers.
column3: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:

column2: If (such) were Our Will, We could send down to them from the sky a Sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: But there comes not to them a newly-revealed Message from (Allah) Most Gracious, but they turn away therefrom.
column3: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor a lawgiver from between his feet, until Shiloh come; and unto him shall the gathering of the people be.

column2: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
column3: O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!

column2: Do they not look at the earth,- how many noble things of all kinds We have produced therein?
column3: Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.

column2: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
column3: Yet in this thing ye did not believe the LORD your God,

column2: And verily, thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-
column3: And the LORD said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt: for all the men are dead which sought thy life.

column2: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
column3: Notwithstanding the children of Korah died not.

column2: He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with falsehood:
column3: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?

column2: "My breast will be straitened. And my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron.
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: "And (further), they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me."
column3: And the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness be a false witness, and hath testified falsely against his brother;

column2: Allah said: "By no means! proceed then, both of you, with Our Signs; We are with you, and will listen (to your call).
column3: And I commanded you at that time, saying, The LORD your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all that are meet for the war.

column2: "So go forth, both of you, to Pharaoh, and say: 'We have been sent by the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds;
column3: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:

column2: "'Send thou with us the Children of Israel.'"
column3: And when it rested, he said, Return, O LORD, unto the many thousands of Israel.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?
column3: And Pharaoh's servants said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?

column2: "And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst, and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!"
column3: Unstable as water, thou shalt not excel; because thou wentest up to thy father's bed; then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch.

column2: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.
column3: And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God shall give Pharaoh an answer of peace.

column2: "So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the messengers.
column3: And I commanded you at that time, saying, The LORD your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all that are meet for the war.

column2: "And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
column3: And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.

column2: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"
column3: Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

column2: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."
column3: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.

column2: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"
column3: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?

column2: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"
column3: And this is the blessing, wherewith Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"
column3: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:

column2: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"
column3: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"
column3: And Israel vowed a vow unto the LORD, and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.

column2: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
column3: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.

column2: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"
column3: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.

column2: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
column3: And when Moses saw that the people were naked; (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies:)

column2: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
column3: And I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good:

column2: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:
column3: And Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,

column2: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: To thy heart and mind, that thou mayest admonish.
column3: Take heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou seest:

column2: In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former peoples.
column3: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

column3: And the officers of the children of Israel did see that they were in evil case, after it was said, Ye shall not minish ought from your bricks of your daily task.

column2: Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs,
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column3: And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.

column2: Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the sinners.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column3: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight because of his son.

column2: But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;
column3: To me belongeth vengeance and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

column2: Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column2: Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on?
column3: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:

column2: Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years,
column3: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:

column2: Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they were promised!
column3: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?

column2: It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
column3: O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!

column2: Never did We destroy a population, but had its warners -
column3: Every raven after his kind;

column2: By way of reminder; and We never are unjust.
column3: For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges.

column2: No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation):
column3: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.

column2: It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce it).
column3: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

column2: Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing it.
column3: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

column2: So call not on any other god with Allah, or thou wilt be among those under the Penalty.
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: And admonish thy nearest kinsmen,
column3: And said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.

column2: And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee.
column3: Because I will publish the name of the LORD: ascribe ye greatness unto our God.

column2: Then if they disobey thee, say: "I am free (of responsibility) for what ye do!"
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,-
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer),
column3: And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.

column2: And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves,
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.
column3: He is thy praise, and he is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.

column2: Shall I inform you, (O people!), on whom it is that the evil ones descend?
column3: And now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.

column2: They descend on every lying, wicked person,
column3: Every raven after his kind;

column2: (Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities, and most of them are liars.
column3: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

column2: And the Poets,- It is those straying in Evil, who follow them:
column3: And divide the prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who went out to battle, and between all the congregation:

column2: Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?-
column3: The fruit of thy land, and all thy labors, shall a nation which thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed alway:

column2: And that they say what they practise not?-
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: Except those who believe, work righteousness, engage much in the remembrance of Allah, and defend themselves only after they are unjustly attacked. And soon will the unjust assailants know what vicissitudes their affairs will take!
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: These are verses of the Qur'an,-a book that makes (things) clear;
column3: This shall be the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation, about the most holy things:

column2: A guide: and glad tidings for the believers,-
column3: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, to serve, and for burdens:

column2: Those who establish regular prayers and give in regular charity, and also have (full) assurance of the hereafter.
column3: The cloths of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.

column2: As to those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds pleasing in their eyes; and so they wander about in distraction.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: Such are they for whom a grievous Penalty is (waiting); and in the Hereafter theirs will be the greatest loss.
column3: To me belongeth vengeance and recompence; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.

column2: As to thee, the Qur'an is bestowed upon thee from the presence of one who is wise and all-knowing.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Behold! Moses said to his family: "I perceive a fire; soon will I bring you from there some information, or I will bring you a burning brand to light our fuel, that ye may warm yourselves.
column3: Then said the LORD unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a certain rate every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or no.

column2: But when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard: "Blessed are those in the fire and those around: and glory to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
column3: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

column2: "O Moses! verily, I am Allah, the exalted in might, the wise!....
column3: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

column2: "Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake, he turned back in retreat, and retraced not his steps: "O Moses!" (it was said), "Fear not: truly, in My presence, those called as messengers have no fear,-
column3: And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God hath done unto us?

column2: "But if any have done wrong and have thereafter substituted good to take the place of evil, truly, I am Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: And the LORD said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.

column2: "Now put thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without stain (or harm): (these are) among the nine Signs (thou wilt take) to Pharaoh and his people: for they are a people rebellious in transgression."
column3: The graven images of their gods shall ye burn with fire: thou shalt not desire the silver or gold that is on them, nor take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therein: for it is an abomination to the LORD thy God.

column2: But when Our Signs came to them, that should have opened their eyes, they said: "This is sorcery manifest!"
column3: And they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.

column2: And they rejected those Signs in iniquity and arrogance, though their souls were convinced thereof: so see what was the end of those who acted corruptly!
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: We gave (in the past) knowledge to David and Solomon: And they both said: "Praise be to Allah, Who has favoured us above many of his servants who believe!"
column3: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:

column2: And Solomon was David's heir. He said: "O ye people! We have been taught the speech of birds, and on us has been bestowed (a little) of all things: this is indeed Grace manifest (from Allah.)"
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts,- of Jinns and men and birds, and they were all kept in order and ranks.
column3: And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, with the captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, which came from the battle.

column2: At length, when they came to a (lowly) valley of ants, one of the ants said: "O ye ants, get into your habitations, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under foot) without knowing it."
column3: And the elders of that city shall bring down the heifer unto a rough valley, which is neither eared nor sown, and shall strike off the heifer's neck there in the valley:

column2: So he smiled, amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favours, which thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: And admit me, by Thy Grace, to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants."
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
column3: And he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:

column2: "I will certainly punish him with a severe penalty, or execute him, unless he bring me a clear reason (for absence)."
column3: Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

column2: But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he (came up and) said: "I have compassed (territory) which thou hast not compassed, and I have come to thee from Saba with tidings true.
column3: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:

column2: "I found (there) a woman ruling over them and provided with every requisite; and she has a magnificent throne.
column3: And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

column2: "I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah: Satan has made their deeds seem pleasing in their eyes, and has kept them away from the Path,- so they receive no guidance,-
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: "(Kept them away from the Path), that they should not worship Allah, Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what ye hide and what ye reveal.
column3: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the LORD, therefore the LORD will not be with you.

column2: "Allah!- there is no god but He!- Lord of the Throne Supreme!"
column3: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.

column2: (Solomon) said: "Soon shall we see whether thou hast told the truth or lied!
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Go thou, with this letter of mine, and deliver it to them: then draw back from them, and (wait to) see what answer they return"...
column3: Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak unto him: and if he stand to it, and say, I like not to take her;

column2: (The queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me - a letter worthy of respect.
column3: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:

column2: "It is from Solomon, and is (as follows): 'In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful:
column3: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

column2: "'Be ye not arrogant against me, but come to me in submission (to the true Religion).'"
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair have I decided except in your presence."
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: They said: "We are endued with strength, and given to vehement war: but the command is with thee; so consider what thou wilt command."
column3: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.

column2: She said: "Kings, when they enter a country, despoil it, and make the noblest of its people its meanest thus do they behave.
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: "But I am going to send him a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ambassadors."
column3: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.

column2: Now when (the embassy) came to Solomon, he said: "Will ye give me abundance in wealth? But that which Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you! Nay it is ye who rejoice in your gift!
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Go back to them, and be sure we shall come to them with such hosts as they will never be able to meet: We shall expel them from there in disgrace, and they will feel humbled (indeed)."
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: He said (to his own men): "Ye chiefs! which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: Said an 'Ifrit, of the Jinns: "I will bring it to thee before thou rise from thy council: indeed I have full strength for the purpose, and may be trusted."
column3: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon: behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.

column2: Said one who had knowledge of the Book: "I will bring it to thee within the twinkling of an eye!" Then when (Solomon) saw it placed firmly before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Lord!- to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! and if any is grateful, truly his gratitude is (a gain) for his own soul; but if any is ungrateful, truly my Lord is Free of all Needs, Supreme in Honour!"
column3: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.

column2: He said: "Transform her throne out of all recognition by her: let us see whether she is guided (to the truth) or is one of those who receive no guidance."
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is this thy throne?" She said, "It was just like this; and knowledge was bestowed on us in advance of this, and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)."
column3: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?

column2: And he diverted her from the worship of others besides Allah: for she was (sprung) of a people that had no faith.
column3: And Moab was sore afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

column2: She was asked to enter the lofty Palace: but when she saw it, she thought it was a lake of water, and she (tucked up her skirts), uncovering her legs. He said: "This is but a palace paved smooth with slabs of glass." She said: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul: I do (now) submit (in Islam), with Solomon, to the Lord of the Worlds."
column3: And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the LORD: Peradventure there shall be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for twenty's sake.

column2: We sent (aforetime), to the Thamud, their brother Salih, saying, "Serve Allah": But behold, they became two factions quarrelling with each other.
column3: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

column2: He said: "O my people! why ask ye to hasten on the evil in preference to the good? If only ye ask Allah for forgiveness, ye may hope to receive mercy.
column3: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.

column2: They said: "Ill omen do we augur from thee and those that are with thee". He said: "Your ill omen is with Allah; yea, ye are a people under trial."
column3: Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

column2: There were in the city nine men of a family, who made mischief in the land, and would not reform.
column3: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

column2: They said: "Swear a mutual oath by Allah that we shall make a secret night attack on him and his people, and that we shall then say to his heir (when he seeks vengeance): 'We were not present at the slaughter of his people, and we are positively telling the truth.'"
column3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

column2: They plotted and planned, but We too planned, even while they perceived it not.
column3: And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.

column2: Then see what was the end of their plot!- this, that We destroyed them and their people, all (of them).
column3: And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

column2: Now such were their houses, - in utter ruin, - because they practised wrong-doing. Verily in this is a Sign for people of knowledge.
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: And We saved those who believed and practised righteousness.
column3: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

column2: (We also sent) Lut (as a messenger): behold, He said to his people, "Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Would ye really approach men in your lusts rather than women? Nay, ye are a people (grossly) ignorant!
column3: Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?

column2: But his people gave no other answer but this: they said, "Drive out the followers of Lut from your city: these are indeed men who want to be clean and pure!"
column3: And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.

column2: But We saved him and his family, except his wife; her We destined to be of those who lagged behind.
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: Say: Praise be to Allah, and Peace on his servants whom He has chosen (for his Message). (Who) is better?- Allah or the false gods they associate (with Him)?
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Or, Who has created the heavens and the earth, and Who sends you down rain from the sky? Yea, with it We cause to grow well-planted orchards full of beauty of delight: it is not in your power to cause the growth of the trees in them. (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay, they are a people who swerve from justice.
column3: That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed: for it is a year of rest unto the land.

column2: Or, Who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar between the two bodies of flowing water? (can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay, most of them know not.
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: Or, Who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him, and Who relieves its suffering, and makes you (mankind) inheritors of the earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Little it is that ye heed!
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Or, Who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea, and Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His Mercy? (Can there be another) god besides Allah?- High is Allah above what they associate with Him!
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: Or, Who originates creation, then repeats it, and who gives you sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Say, "Bring forth your argument, if ye are telling the truth!"
column3: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

column2: Say: None in the heavens or on earth, except Allah, knows what is hidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for Judgment).
column3: Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:

column2: Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: Nay, they are in doubt and uncertainty thereanent; nay, they are blind thereunto!
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: The Unbelievers say: "What! when we become dust,- we and our fathers,- shall we really be raised (from the dead)?
column3: Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.

column2: "It is true we were promised this,- we and our fathers before (us): these are nothing but tales of the ancients."
column3: That ye shall say, Thy servants' trade hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.

column2: Say: "Go ye through the earth and see what has been the end of those guilty (of sin)."
column3: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.

column2: But grieve not over them, nor distress thyself because of their plots.
column3: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not suffer sin upon him.

column2: They also say: "When will this promise (come to pass)? (Say) if ye are truthful."
column3: Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the LORD.

column2: Say: "It may be that some of the events which ye wish to hasten on may be (close) in your pursuit!"
column3: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:

column2: But verily thy Lord is full of grace to mankind: Yet most of them are ungrateful.
column3: Thou shalt not be affrighted at them: for the LORD thy God is among you, a mighty God and terrible.

column2: And verily thy Lord knoweth all that their hearts do hide. As well as all that they reveal.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Nor is there aught of the unseen, in heaven or earth, but is (recorded) in a clear record.
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Verily this Qur'an doth explain to the Children of Israel most of the matters in which they disagree.
column3: And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:

column2: And it certainly is a Guide and a Mercy to those who believe.
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: Verily thy Lord will decide between them by His Decree: and He is Exalted in Might, All-Knowing.
column3: There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellency on the sky.

column2: So put thy trust in Allah: for thou art on (the path of) manifest Truth.
column3: Thou shalt therefore sacrifice the passover unto the LORD thy God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the LORD shall choose to place his name there.

column2: Truly thou canst not cause the dead to listen, nor canst thou cause the deaf to hear the call, (especially) when they turn back in retreat.
column3: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:

column2: Nor canst thou be a guide to the blind, (to prevent them) from straying: only those wilt thou get to listen who believe in Our Signs, and they will bow in Islam.
column3: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:

column2: And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust), we shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: He will speak to them, for that mankind did not believe with assurance in Our Signs.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: One day We shall gather together from every people a troop of those who reject our Signs, and they shall be kept in ranks,-
column3: And it shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking unto the people that they shall make captains of the armies to lead the people.

column2: Until, when they come (before the Judgment-seat), (Allah) will say: "Did ye reject My Signs, though ye comprehended them not in knowledge, or what was it ye did?"
column3: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?

column2: And the Word will be fulfilled against them, because of their wrong-doing, and they will be unable to speak (in plea).
column3: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.

column2: See they not that We have made the Night for them to rest in and the Day to give them light? Verily in this are Signs for any people that believe!
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: And the Day that the Trumpet will be sounded - then will be smitten with terror those who are in the heavens, and those who are on earth, except such as Allah will please (to exempt): and all shall come to His (Presence) as beings conscious of their lowliness.
column3: And it shall come to pass, that the man's rod, whom I shall choose, shall blossom: and I will make to cease from me the murmurings of the children of Israel, whereby they murmur against you.

column2: Thou seest the mountains and thinkest them firmly fixed: but they shall pass away as the clouds pass away: (such is) the artistry of Allah, who disposes of all things in perfect order: for he is well acquainted with all that ye do.
column3: Understand therefore this day, that the LORD thy God is he which goeth over before thee; as a consuming fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down before thy face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as the LORD hath said unto thee.

column2: If any do good, good will (accrue) to them therefrom; and they will be secure from terror that Day.
column3: Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares.

column2: And if any do evil, their faces will be thrown headlong into the Fire: "Do ye receive a reward other than that which ye have earned by your deeds?"
column3: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
