column3: When a prophet speaketh in the name of the LORD, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.

column2: It is Allah Who made cattle for you, that ye may use some for riding and some for food;
column3: Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.

column2: And there are (other) advantages in them for you (besides); that ye may through them attain to any need (there may be) in your hearts; and on them and on ships ye are carried.
column3: Then ye shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which killeth any person at unawares.

column2: And He shows you (always) His Signs: then which of the Signs of Allah will ye deny?
column3: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?

column2: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were more numerous than these and superior in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the land: Yet all that they accomplished was of no profit to them.
column3: Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, The people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakims there.

column2: For when their messengers came to them with Clear Signs, they exulted in such knowledge (and skill) as they had; but that very (Wrath) at which they were wont to scoff hemmed them in.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: But when they saw Our Punishment, they said: "We believe in Allah,- the one Allah - and we reject the partners we used to join with Him."
column3: And Nadab and Abihu died, when they offered strange fire before the LORD.

column2: But their professing the Faith when they (actually) saw Our Punishment was not going to profit them. (Such has been) Allah's Way of dealing with His Servants (from the most ancient times). And even thus did the Rejecters of Allah perish (utterly)!
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: Ha Mim:
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: A Revelation from (Allah), Most Gracious, Most Merciful;-
column3: And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, long-suffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,

column2: A Book, whereof the verses are explained in detail;- a Qur'an in Arabic, for people who understand;-
column3: If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;

column2: Giving good news and admonition: yet most of them turn away, and so they hear not.
column3: But they shall not go in to see when the holy things are covered, lest they die.

column2: They say: "Our hearts are under veils, (concealed) from that to which thou dost invite us, and in our ears in a deafness, and between us and thee is a screen: so do thou (what thou wilt); for us, we shall do (what we will!)"
column3: Only rebel not ye against the LORD, neither fear ye the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defense is departed from them, and the LORD is with us: fear them not.

column2: Say thou: "I am but a man like you: It is revealed to me by Inspiration, that your Allah is one Allah: so stand true to Him, and ask for His Forgiveness." And woe to those who join gods with Allah,-
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: Those who practise not regular Charity, and who even deny the Hereafter.
column3: Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering: it is most holy.

column2: For those who believe and work deeds of righteousness is a reward that will never fail.
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: Say: Is it that ye deny Him Who created the earth in two Days? And do ye join equals with Him? He is the Lord of (all) the Worlds.
column3: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.

column2: He set on the (earth), mountains standing firm, high above it, and bestowed blessings on the earth, and measure therein all things to give them nourishment in due proportion, in four Days, in accordance with (the needs of) those who seek (Sustenance).
column3: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

column2: Moreover He comprehended in His design the sky, and it had been (as) smoke: He said to it and to the earth: "Come ye together, willingly or unwillingly." They said: "We do come (together), in willing obedience."
column3: And Isaac his father answered and said unto him, Behold, thy dwelling shall be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of heaven from above;

column2: So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights, and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might, Full of Knowledge.
column3: And he provided the first part for himself, because there, in a portion of the lawgiver, was he seated; and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the LORD, and his judgments with Israel.

column2: But if they turn away, say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning Punishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which (overtook) the 'Ad and the Thamud!"
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: Behold, the messengers came to them, from before them and behind them, (preaching): "Serve none but Allah." They said, "If our Lord had so pleased, He would certainly have sent down angels (to preach). Now we reject your mission (altogether)."
column3: And I commanded you at that time, saying, The LORD your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all that are meet for the war.

column2: Now the 'Ad behaved arrogantly through the land, against (all) truth and reason, and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?" What! did they not see that Allah, Who created them, was superior to them in strength? But they continued to reject Our Signs!
column3: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

column2: So We sent against them a furious Wind through days of disaster, that We might give them a taste of a Penalty of humiliation in this life; but the Penalty of a Hereafter will be more humiliating still: and they will find no help.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: As to the Thamud, We gave them Guidance, but they preferred blindness (of heart) to Guidance: so the stunning Punishment of humiliation seized them, because of what they had earned.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: But We delivered those who believed and practised righteousness.
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: On the Day that the enemies of Allah will be gathered together to the Fire, they will be marched in ranks.
column3: And be ready against the third day: for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.

column2: At length, when they reach the (Fire), their hearing, their sight, and their skins will bear witness against them, as to (all) their deeds.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: They will say to their skins: "Why bear ye witness against us?" They will say: "Allah hath given us speech,- (He) Who giveth speech to everything: He created you for the first time, and unto Him were ye to return.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: "Ye did not seek to hide yourselves, lest your hearing, your sight, and your skins should bear witness against you! But ye did think that Allah knew not many of the things that ye used to do!
column3: But even a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you: because that ye have despised the LORD which is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?

column2: "But this thought of yours which ye did entertain concerning your Lord, hath brought you to destruction, and (now) have ye become of those utterly lost!"
column3: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.

column2: If, then, they have patience, the Fire will be a home for them! and if they beg to be received into favour, into favour will they not (then) be received.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: And We have destined for them intimate companions (of like nature), who made alluring to them what was before them and behind them; and the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men, who have passed away, is proved against them; for they are utterly lost.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: The Unbelievers say: "Listen not to this Qur'an, but talk at random in the midst of its (reading), that ye may gain the upper hand!"
column3: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:

column2: But We will certainly give the Unbelievers a taste of a severe Penalty, and We will requite them for the worst of their deeds.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Such is the requital of the enemies of Allah,- the Fire: therein will be for them the Eternal Home: a (fit) requital, for that they were wont to reject Our Signs.
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: And the Unbelievers will say: "Our Lord! Show us those, among Jinns and men, who misled us: We shall crush them beneath our feet, so that they become the vilest (before all)."
column3: For they will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of the LORD be kindled against you, and destroy thee suddenly.

column2: In the case of those who say, "Our Lord is Allah", and, further, stand straight and steadfast, the angels descend on them (from time to time): "Fear ye not!" (they suggest), "Nor grieve! but receive the Glad Tidings of the Garden (of Bliss), the which ye were promised!
column3: When they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the LORD:

column2: "We are your protectors in this life and in the Hereafter: therein shall ye have all that your souls shall desire; therein shall ye have all that ye ask for!-
column3: And bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: so will I deliver you your brother, and ye shall traffic in the land.

column2: "A hospitable gift from one Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful!"
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: Who is better in speech than one who calls (men) to Allah, works righteousness, and says, "I am of those who bow in Islam"?
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Nor can goodness and Evil be equal. Repel (Evil) with what is better: Then will he between whom and thee was hatred become as it were thy friend and intimate!
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: And no one will be granted such goodness except those who exercise patience and self-restraint,- none but persons of the greatest good fortune.
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: And if (at any time) an incitement to discord is made to thee by the Evil One, seek refuge in Allah. He is the One Who hears and knows all things.
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a jealous God among you) lest the anger of the LORD thy God be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face of the earth.

column2: Among His Signs are the Night and the Day, and the Sun and the Moon. Do not prostrate to the sun and the moon, but prostrate to Allah, Who created them, if it is Him ye wish to serve.
column3: Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.

column2: But is the (Unbelievers) are arrogant, (no matter): for in the presence of thy Lord are those who celebrate His praises by night and by day. And they never flag (nor feel themselves above it).
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: And among His Signs in this: thou seest the earth barren and desolate; but when We send down rain to it, it is stirred to life and yields increase. Truly, He Who gives life to the (dead) earth can surely give life to (men) who are dead. For He has power over all things.
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: Those who pervert the Truth in Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Which is better?- he that is cast into the Fire, or he that comes safe through, on the Day of Judgment? Do what ye will: verily He seeth (clearly) all that ye do.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Those who reject the Message when it comes to them (are not hidden from Us). And indeed it is a Book of exalted power.
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: No falsehood can approach it from before or behind it: It is sent down by One Full of Wisdom, Worthy of all Praise.
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Nothing is said to thee that was not said to the messengers before thee: that thy lord has at his Command (all) forgiveness as well as a most Grievous Penalty.
column3: Pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.

column2: Had We sent this as a Qur'an (in the language) other than Arabic, they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger an Arab?" Say: "It is a Guide and a Healing to those who believe; and for those who believe not, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness in their (eyes): They are (as it were) being called from a place far distant!"
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but disputes arose therein. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their differences) would have been settled between them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon.
column3: And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles are befallen them, that this song shall testify against them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they go about, even now, before I have brought them into the land which I sware.

column2: Whoever works righteousness benefits his own soul; whoever works evil, it is against his own soul: nor is thy Lord ever unjust (in the least) to His Servants.
column3: When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;

column2: To Him is referred the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment: He knows all): No date-fruit comes out of its sheath, nor does a female conceive (within her womb) nor bring forth the Day that (Allah) will propound to them the (question), "Where are the partners (ye attributed to Me?" They will say, "We do assure thee not one of us can bear witness!"
column3: The sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor a lawgiver from between his feet, until Shiloh come; and unto him shall the gathering of the people be.

column2: The (deities) they used to invoke aforetime will leave them in the lurch, and they will perceive that they have no way of escape.
column3: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.

column2: Man does not weary of asking for good (things), but if ill touches him, he gives up all hope (and) is lost in despair.
column3: And the LORD smelled a sweet savor; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

column2: When we give him a taste of some Mercy from Ourselves, after some adversity has touched him, he is sure to say, "This is due to my (merit): I think not that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) be established; but if I am brought back to my Lord, I have (much) good (stored) in His sight!" But We will show the Unbelievers the truth of all that they did, and We shall give them the taste of a severe Penalty.
column3: And the LORD smelled a sweet savor; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

column2: When We bestow favours on man, he turns away, and gets himself remote on his side (instead of coming to Us); and when evil seizes him, (he comes) full of prolonged prayer!
column3: And when the sun is down, he shall be clean, and shall afterward eat of the holy things; because it is his food.

column2: Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah, and yet do ye reject it? Who is more astray than one who is in a schism far (from any purpose)?"
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: Soon will We show them our Signs in the (furthest) regions (of the earth), and in their own souls, until it becomes manifest to them that this is the Truth. Is it not enough that thy Lord doth witness all things?
column3: For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? is it not in that thou goest with us? so shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.

column2: Ah indeed! Are they in doubt concerning the Meeting with their Lord? Ah indeed! It is He that doth encompass all things!
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: Ha-Mim
column3: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

column2: Ain. Sin. Qaf.
column3: And Atroth, Shophan, and Jaazer, and Jogbehah,

column2: Thus doth (He) send inspiration to thee as (He did) to those before thee,- Allah, Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.
column3: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

column2: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: and He is Most High, Most Great.
column3: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

column2: The heavens are almost rent asunder from above them (by Him Glory): and the angels celebrate the Praises of their Lord, and pray for forgiveness for (all) beings on earth: Behold! Verily Allah is He, the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
column3: The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee; and shall say, Destroy them.

column2: And those who take as protectors others besides Him,- Allah doth watch over them; and thou art not the disposer of their affairs.
column3: And the Levite that is within thy gates; thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.

column2: Thus have We sent by inspiration to thee an Arabic Qur'an: that thou mayest warn the Mother of Cities and all around her,- and warn (them) of the Day of Assembly, of which there is no doubt: (when) some will be in the Garden, and some in the Blazing Fire.
column3: And this is the law of the Nazarite, when the days of his separation are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:

column2: If Allah had so willed, He could have made them a single people; but He admits whom He will to His Mercy; and the Wrong-doers will have no protector nor helper.
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: What! Have they taken (for worship) protectors besides Him? But it is Allah,- He is the Protector, and it is He Who gives life to the dead: It is He Who has power over all things,
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Whatever it be wherein ye differ, the decision thereof is with Allah: such is Allah my Lord: In Him I trust, and to Him I turn.
column3: Ye shall therefore keep my statutes, and my judgments: which if a man do, he shall live in them: I am the LORD.

column2: (He is) the Creator of the heavens and the earth: He has made for you pairs from among yourselves, and pairs among cattle: by this means does He multiply you: there is nothing whatever like unto Him, and He is the One that hears and sees (all things).
column3: For the LORD your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:

column2: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: He enlarges and restricts. The Sustenance to whom He will: for He knows full well all things.
column3: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

column2: The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah - the which We have sent by inspiration to thee - and that which We enjoined on Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: Namely, that ye should remain steadfast in religion, and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah, hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases, and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him).
column3: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, thy servants, to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.

column2: And they became divided only after Knowledge reached them,- through selfish envy as between themselves. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (tending) to a Term appointed, the matter would have been settled between them: But truly those who have inherited the Book after them are in suspicious (disquieting) doubt concerning it.
column3: That the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbor unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:

column2: Now then, for that (reason), call (them to the Faith), and stand steadfast as thou art commanded, nor follow thou their vain desires; but say: "I believe in the Book which Allah has sent down; and I am commanded to judge justly between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord: for us (is the responsibility for) our deeds, and for you for your deeds. There is no contention between us and you. Allah will bring us together, and to Him is (our) Final Goal.
column3: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.

column2: But those who dispute concerning Allah after He has been accepted,- futile is their dispute in the Sight of their Lord: on them will be a Penalty terrible.
column3: But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that pertain unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.

column2: It is Allah Who has sent down the Book in Truth, and the Balance (by which to weigh conduct). And what will make thee realise that perhaps the Hour is close at hand?
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Only those wish to hasten it who believe not in it: those who believe hold it in awe, and know that it is the Truth. Behold, verily those that dispute concerning the Hour are far astray.
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Gracious is Allah to His servants: He gives Sustenance to whom He pleases: and He has power and can carry out His Will.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: To any that desires the tilth of the Hereafter, We give increase in his tilth, and to any that desires the tilth of this world, We grant somewhat thereof, but he has no share or lot in the Hereafter.
column3: But he shall acknowledge the son of the hated for the firstborn, by giving him a double portion of all that he hath: for he is the beginning of his strength; the right of the firstborn is his.

column2: What! have they partners (in godhead), who have established for them some religion without the permission of Allah? Had it not been for the Decree of Judgment, the matter would have been decided between them (at once). But verily the Wrong-doers will have a grievous Penalty.
column3: When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;

column2: Thou wilt see the Wrong-doers in fear on account of what they have earned, and (the burden of) that must (necessarily) fall on them. But those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in the luxuriant meads of the Gardens: they shall have, before their Lord, all that they wish for. That will indeed be the magnificent Bounty (of Allah).
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: That is (the Bounty) whereof Allah gives Glad Tidings to His Servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this except the love of those near of kin." And if any one earns any good, We shall give him an increase of good in respect thereof: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Ready to appreciate (service).
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: What! Do they say, "He has forged a falsehood against Allah"? But if Allah willed, He could seal up thy heart. And Allah blots out Vanity, and proves the Truth by His Words. For He knows well the secrets of all hearts.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: He is the One that accepts repentance from His Servants and forgives sins: and He knows all that ye do.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: And He listens to those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, and gives them increase of His Bounty: but for the Unbelievers their is a terrible Penalty.
column3: The LORD is long-suffering, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation.

column2: If Allah were to enlarge the provision for His Servants, they would indeed transgress beyond all bounds through the earth; but he sends (it) down in due measure as He pleases. For He is with His Servants Well-acquainted, Watchful.
column3: But if he sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon unto him the money according to the years that remain, even unto the year of the jubilee, and it shall be abated from thy estimation.

column2: He is the One that sends down rain (even) after (men) have given up all hope, and scatters His Mercy (far and wide). And He is the Protector, Worthy of all Praise.
column3: The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee; and shall say, Destroy them.

column2: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.
column3: For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.

column2: Whatever misfortune happens to you, is because on the things your hands have wrought, and for many (of them) He grants forgiveness.
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: Nor can ye frustrate (aught), (fleeing) through the earth; nor have ye, besides Allah, any one to protect or to help.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: And among His Signs are the ships, smooth-running through the ocean, (tall) as mountains.
column3: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto Elparan, which is by the wilderness.

column2: If it be His Will He can still the Wind: then would they become motionless on the back of the (ocean). Verily in this are Signs for everyone who patiently perseveres and is grateful.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Or He can cause them to perish because of the (evil) which (the men) have earned; but much doth He forgive.
column3: And this is the case of the slayer, which shall flee thither, that he may live: Whoso killeth his neighbor ignorantly, whom he hated not in time past;

column2: But let those know, who dispute about Our Signs, that there is for them no way of escape.
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: Whatever ye are given (here) is (but) a convenience of this life: but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting: (it is) for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord:
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Those who avoid the greater crimes and shameful deeds, and, when they are angry even then forgive;
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: Those who hearken to their Lord, and establish regular Prayer; who (conduct) their affairs by mutual Consultation; who spend out of what We bestow on them for Sustenance;
column3: When they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the LORD:

column2: And those who, when an oppressive wrong is inflicted on them, (are not cowed but) help and defend themselves.
column3: This is the law of jealousies, when a wife goeth aside to another instead of her husband, and is defiled;

column2: The recompense for an injury is an injury equal thereto (in degree): but if a person forgives and makes reconciliation, his reward is due from Allah: for (Allah) loveth not those who do wrong.
column3: As the sin offering is, so is the trespass offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement therewith shall have it.

column2: But indeed if any do help and defend themselves after a wrong (done) to them, against such there is no cause of blame.
column3: And if any one of the common people sin through ignorance, while he doeth somewhat against any of the commandments of the LORD concerning things which ought not to be done, and be guilty;

column2: The blame is only against those who oppress men and wrong-doing and insolently transgress beyond bounds through the land, defying right and justice: for such there will be a penalty grievous.
column3: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.

column2: But indeed if any show patience and forgive, that would truly be an exercise of courageous will and resolution in the conduct of affairs.
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: For any whom Allah leaves astray, there is no protector thereafter. And thou wilt see the Wrong-doers, when in sight of the Penalty, Say: "Is there any way (to effect) a return?"
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: And thou wilt see them brought forward to the (Penalty), in a humble frame of mind because of (their) disgrace, (and) looking with a stealthy glance. And the Believers will say: "Those are indeed in loss, who have given to perdition their own selves and those belonging to them on the Day of Judgment. Behold! Truly the Wrong-doers are in a lasting Penalty!"
column3: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

column2: And no protectors have they to help them, other than Allah. And for any whom Allah leaves to stray, there is no way (to the Goal).
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: Hearken ye to your Lord, before there come a Day which there will be no putting back, because of (the Ordainment of) Allah! that Day there will be for you no place of refuge nor will there be for you any room for denial (of your sins)!
column3: According to all that thou desiredst of the LORD thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.

column2: If then they run away, We have not sent thee as a guard over them. Thy duty is but to convey (the Message). And truly, when We give man a taste of a Mercy from Ourselves, he doth exult thereat, but when some ill happens to him, on account of the deeds which his hands have sent forth, truly then is man ungrateful!
column3: His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt in any wise bury him that day; (for he that is hanged is accursed of God;) that thy land be not defiled, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

column2: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills (and plans). He bestows (children) male or female according to His Will (and Plan),
column3: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.

column2: Or He bestows both males and females, and He leaves barren whom He will: for He is full of Knowledge and Power.
column3: God brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.

column2: It is not fitting for a man that Allah should speak to him except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by the sending of a messenger to reveal, with Allah's permission, what Allah wills: for He is Most High, Most Wise.
column3: He hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:

column2: And thus have We, by Our Command, sent inspiration to thee: thou knewest not (before) what was Revelation, and what was Faith; but We have made the (Qur'an) a Light, wherewith We guide such of Our servants as We will; and verily thou dost guide (men) to the Straight Way,-
column3: And thou shalt remember all the way which the LORD thy God led thee these forty years in the wilderness, to humble thee, and to prove thee, to know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his commandments, or no.

column2: The Way of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth. Behold (how) all affairs tend towards Allah!
column3: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.

column2: Ha-Mim
column3: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

column2: By the Book that makes things clear,-
column3: A several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

column2: We have made it a Qur'an in Arabic, that ye may be able to understand (and learn wisdom).
column3: Now therefore write ye this song for you, and teach it the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel.

column2: And verily, it is in the Mother of the Book, in Our Presence, high (in dignity), full of wisdom.
column3: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.

column2: Shall We then take away the Message from you and repel (you), for that ye are a people transgressing beyond bounds?
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: But how many were the prophets We sent amongst the peoples of old?
column3: (Now the man Moses was very meek, above all the men which were upon the face of the earth.)

column2: And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
column3: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.

column2: So We destroyed (them)- stronger in power than these;- and (thus) has passed on the Parable of the peoples of old.
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: If thou wert to question them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' They would be sure to reply, 'they were created by (Him), the Exalted in Power, Full of Knowledge';-
column3: Then thou shalt say unto thy son, We were Pharaoh's bondmen in Egypt; and the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand:

column2: (Yea, the same that) has made for you the earth (like a carpet) spread out, and has made for you roads (and channels) therein, in order that ye may find guidance (on the way);
column3: But the land, whither ye go to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys, and drinketh water of the rain of heaven:

column2: That sends down (from time to time) rain from the sky in due measure;- and We raise to life therewith a land that is dead; even so will ye be raised (from the dead);-
column3: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

column2: That has created pairs in all things, and has made for you ships and cattle on which ye ride,
column3: Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which hath proceeded out of your mouth.

column2: In order that ye may sit firm and square on their backs, and when so seated, ye may celebrate the (kind) favour of your Lord, and say, "Glory to Him Who has subjected these to our (use), for we could never have accomplished this (by ourselves),
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: "And to our Lord, surely, must we turn back!"
column3: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.

column2: Yet they attribute to some of His servants a share with Him (in his godhead)! truly is man a blasphemous ingrate avowed!
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: What! has He taken daughters out of what He himself creates, and granted to you sons for choice?
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) what he sets up as a likeness to (Allah) Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief!
column3: Or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon him, and he be jealous over his wife, and shall set the woman before the LORD, and the priest shall execute upon her all this law.

column2: Is then one brought up among trinkets, and unable to give a clear account in a dispute (to be associated with Allah)?
column3: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.

column2: And they make into females angels who themselves serve Allah. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded, and they will be called to account!
column3: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.

column2: ("Ah!") they say, "If it had been the will of (Allah) Most Gracious, we should not have worshipped such (deities)!" Of that they have no knowledge! they do nothing but lie!
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: What! have We given them a Book before this, to which they are holding fast?
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column2: Nay! they say: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we do guide ourselves by their footsteps."
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: Just in the same way, whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any people, the wealthy ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we will certainly follow in their footsteps."
column3: Of the children of Naphtali, throughout their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

column2: He said: "What! Even if I brought you better guidance than that which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us, we deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all)."
column3: And they said, The man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?

column2: So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of those who rejected (Truth)!
column3: (For the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)

column2: Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:
column3: Then spake the chief butler unto Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:

column2: "(I worship) only Him Who made me, and He will certainly guide me."
column3: And showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.

column2: And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him, that they may turn back (to Allah).
column3: Moreover the LORD thy God will send the hornet among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves from thee, be destroyed.

column2: Yea, I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and their fathers, until the Truth has come to them, and a messenger making things clear.
column3: Behold now, I have two daughters which have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof.

column2: But when the Truth came to them, they said: "This is sorcery, and we do reject it."
column3: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife's sake.

column2: Also, they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some leading man in either of the two (chief) cities?"
column3: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

column2: Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of thy Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this world: and We raise some of them above others in ranks, so that some may command work from others. But the Mercy of thy Lord is better than the (wealth) which they amass.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: And were it not that (all) men might become of one (evil) way of life, We would provide, for everyone that blasphemes against (Allah) Most Gracious, silver roofs for their houses and (silver) stair-ways on which to go up,
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: And (silver) doors to their houses, and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline,
column3: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.

column2: And also adornments of gold. But all this were nothing but conveniences of the present life: The Hereafter, in the sight of thy Lord is for the Righteous.
column3: All that are born of the country shall do these things after this manner, in offering an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the LORD.

column2: If anyone withdraws himself from remembrance of (Allah) Most Gracious, We appoint for him an evil one, to be an intimate companion to him.
column3: If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the LORD for a sin offering.

column2: Such (evil ones) really hinder them from the Path, but they think that they are being guided aright!
column3: Naphtali is a hind let loose: he giveth goodly words.

column2: At length, when (such a one) comes to Us, he says (to his evil companion): "Would that between me and thee were the distance of East and West!" Ah! evil is the companion (indeed)!
column3: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?

column2: When ye have done wrong, it will avail you nothing, that Day, that ye shall be partners in Punishment!
column3: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.

column2: Canst thou then make the deaf to hear, or give direction to the blind or to such as (wander) in manifest error?
column3: Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brethren, or of thy strangers that are in thy land within thy gates:

column2: Even if We take thee away, We shall be sure to exact retribution from them,
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: Or We shall show thee that (accomplished) which We have promised them: for verily We shall prevail over them.
column3: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

column2: So hold thou fast to the Revelation sent down to thee; verily thou art on a Straight Way.
column3: Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that thou observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so ye shall observe to do.

column2: The (Qur'an) is indeed the message, for thee and for thy people; and soon shall ye (all) be brought to account.
column3: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.

column2: And question thou our messengers whom We sent before thee; did We appoint any deities other than (Allah) Most Gracious, to be worshipped?
column3: And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all.

column2: We did send Moses aforetime, with Our Signs, to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said, "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."
column3: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.

column2: But when he came to them with Our Signs, behold they ridiculed them.
column3: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

column2: We showed them Sign after Sign, each greater than its fellow, and We seized them with Punishment, in order that they might turn (to Us).
column3: And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

column2: And they said, "O thou sorcerer! Invoke thy Lord for us according to His covenant with thee; for we shall truly accept guidance."
column3: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

column2: But when We removed the Penalty from them, behold, they broke their word.
column3: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.

column2: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me, (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?
column3: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?

column2: "Am I not better than this (Moses), who is a contemptible wretch and can scarcely express himself clearly?
column3: And Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel: and he said, Am I in God's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?

column2: "Then why are not gold bracelets bestowed on him, or (why) come (not) with him angels accompanying him in procession?"
column3: If the priest's daughter also be married unto a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.

column2: Thus did he make fools of his people, and they obeyed him: truly were they a people rebellious (against Allah).
column3: And Joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before him with their faces to the earth.

column2: When at length they provoked Us, We exacted retribution from them, and We drowned them all.
column3: And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.

column2: And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later ages.
column3: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.

column2: When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example, behold, thy people raise a clamour thereat (in ridicule)!
column3: And when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy place, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat:

column2: And they say, "Are our gods best, or he?" This they set forth to thee, only by way of disputation: yea, they are a contentious people.
column3: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.

column2: He was no more than a servant: We granted Our favour to him, and We made him an example to the Children of Israel.
column3: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go out of his land.

column2: And if it were Our Will, We could make angels from amongst you, succeeding each other on the earth.
column3: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.

column2: And (Jesus) shall be a Sign (for the coming of) the Hour (of Judgment): therefore have no doubt about the (Hour), but follow ye Me: this is a Straight Way.
column3: Also on the tenth day of this seventh month there shall be a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

column2: Let not the Evil One hinder you: for he is to you an enemy avowed.
column3: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.

column2: When Jesus came with Clear Signs, he said: "Now have I come to you with Wisdom, and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear Allah and obey me.
column3: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.

column2: "For Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this is a Straight Way."
column3: Ye shall not fear them: for the LORD your God he shall fight for you.

column2: But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe to the wrong-doers, from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!
column3: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

column2: Do they only wait for the Hour - that it should come on them all of a sudden, while they perceive not?
column3: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, what time the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men: and they became a sign.

column2: Friends on that day will be foes, one to another,- except the Righteous.
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day, nor shall ye grieve,-
column3: And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;

column2: (Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their wills to Ours) in Islam.
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: Enter ye the Garden, ye and your wives, in (beauty and) rejoicing.
column3: And ye shall eat it in every place, ye and your households: for it is your reward for your service in the tabernacle of the congregation.

column2: To them will be passed round, dishes and goblets of gold: there will be there all that the souls could desire, all that their eyes could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for eye).
column3: And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

column2: Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your (good) deeds (in life).
column3: If he sanctify his field from the year of jubilee, according to thy estimation it shall stand.

column2: Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit, from which ye shall have satisfaction.
column3: Then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield her increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.

column2: The sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell, to dwell therein (for aye):
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Nowise will the (Punishment) be lightened for them, and in despair will they be there overwhelmed.
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been unjust themselves.
column3: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

column2: They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Nay, but ye shall abide!"
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: Verily We have brought the Truth to you: but most of you have a hatred for Truth.
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: What! have they settled some plan (among themselves)? But it is We Who settle things.
column3: And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.

column2: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsels? Indeed (We do), and Our messengers are by them, to record.
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: Say: "If (Allah) Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship."
column3: And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they went both of them together.

column2: Glory to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne (of Authority)! (He is free) from the things they attribute (to him)!
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: So leave them to babble and play (with vanities) until they meet that Day of theirs, which they have been promised.
column3: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.

column2: It is He Who is Allah in heaven and Allah on earth; and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge.
column3: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.

column2: And blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and all between them: with Him is the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment): and to Him shall ye be brought back.
column3: For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him, and they shall keep the way of the LORD, to do justice and judgment; that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him.

column2: And those whom they invoke besides Allah have no power of intercession;- only he who bears witness to the Truth, and they know (him).
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: If thou ask them, who created them, they will certainly say, Allah: How then are they deluded away (from the Truth)?
column3: Or if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:

column2: (Allah has knowledge) of the (Prophet's) cry, "O my Lord! Truly these are people who will not believe!"
column3: And the LORD said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.

column2: But turn away from them, and say "Peace!" But soon shall they know!
column3: And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end shall be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.

column2: Ha-Mim.
column3: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

column2: By the Book that makes things clear;-
column3: A several tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs:

column2: We sent it down during a Blessed Night: for We (ever) wish to warn (against Evil).
column3: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

column2: In the (Night) is made distinct every affair of wisdom,
column3: A several tenth deal unto one lamb, throughout the seven lambs;

column2: By command, from Our Presence. For We (ever) send (revelations),
column3: And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the LORD which sanctify you.

column2: As Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them, if ye (but) have an assured faith.
column3: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD's thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.

column2: There is no god but He: It is He Who gives life and gives death,- The Lord and Cherisher to you and your earliest ancestors.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Yet they play about in doubt.
column3: And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats' hair.

column2: Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind of smoke (or mist) plainly visible,
column3: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

column2: Enveloping the people: this will be a Penalty Grievous.
column3: And the thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight because of his son.

column2: (They will say:) "Our Lord! remove the Penalty from us, for we do really believe!"
column3: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

column2: How shall the message be (effectual) for them, seeing that an Messenger explaining things clearly has (already) come to them,-
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: Yet they turn away from him and say: "Tutored (by others), a man possessed!"
column3: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?

column2: We shall indeed remove the Penalty for a while, (but) truly ye will revert (to your ways).
column3: Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your work shall be diminished.

column2: One day We shall seize you with a mighty onslaught: We will indeed (then) exact Retribution!
column3: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:

column2: We did, before them, try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them a messenger most honourable,
column3: The man, who is the lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.

column2: Saying: "Restore to me the Servants of Allah: I am to you an messenger worthy of all trust;
column3: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.

column2: "And be not arrogant as against Allah: for I come to you with authority manifest.
column3: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

column2: "For me, I have sought safety with my Lord and your Lord, against your injuring me.
column3: And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:

column2: "If ye believe me not, at least keep yourselves away from me."
column3: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.

column2: (But they were aggressive:) then he cried to his Lord: "These are indeed a people given to sin."
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: (The reply came:) "March forth with My Servants by night: for ye are sure to be pursued.
column3: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to morrow will I bring the locusts into thy coast:

column2: "And leave the sea as a furrow (divided): for they are a host (destined) to be drowned."
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: How many were the gardens and springs they left behind,
column3: And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.

column2: And corn-fields and noble buildings,
column3: And on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;

column2: And wealth (and conveniences of life), wherein they had taken such delight!
column3: And ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them:)

column2: Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those things)!
column3: (For the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)

column2: And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they given a respite (again).
column3: And they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.

column2: We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating Punishment,
column3: Every sabbath he shall set it in order before the LORD continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.

column2: Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.
column3: For the Egyptians buried all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them: upon their gods also the LORD executed judgments.

column2: And We chose them aforetime above the nations, knowingly,
column3: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.

column2: And granted them Signs in which there was a manifest trial
column3: And for that the dream was doubled unto Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

column2: As to these (Quraish), they say forsooth:
column3: Issachar is a strong ass couching down between two burdens:

column2: "There is nothing beyond our first death, and we shall not be raised again.
column3: And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.

column2: "Then bring (back) our forefathers, if what ye say is true!"
column3: And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father's brethren.

column2: What! Are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were before them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.
column3: And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.

column2: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, merely in (idle) sport:
column3: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;

column2: We created them not except for just ends: but most of them do not understand.
column3: For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges.

column2: Verily the Day of sorting out is the time appointed for all of them,-
column3: And they made ready the present against Joseph came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.

column2: The Day when no protector can avail his client in aught, and no help can they receive,
column3: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger; that the manslayer die not, until he stand before the congregation in judgment.

column2: Except such as receive Allah's Mercy: for He is Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
column3: Know therefore that the LORD thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;

column2: Verily the tree of Zaqqum
column3: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

column2: Will be the food of the Sinful,-
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: Like molten brass; it will boil in their insides.
column3: But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;

column2: Like the boiling of scalding water.
column3: Their wine is the poison of dragons, and the cruel venom of asps.

column2: (A voice will cry: "Seize ye him and drag him into the midst of the Blazing Fire!
column3: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?

column2: "Then pour over his head the Penalty of Boiling Water,
column3: And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash withal.

column2: "Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou mighty, full of honour!
column3: Yea, he loved the people; all his saints are in thy hand: and they sat down at thy feet; every one shall receive of thy words.

column2: "Truly this is what ye used to doubt!"
column3: Ye shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes.

column2: As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security,
column3: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, to serve, and for burdens:

column2: Among Gardens and Springs;
column3: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

column2: Dressed in fine silk and in rich brocade, they will face each other;
column3: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

column2: So; and We shall join them to fair women with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes.
column3: The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.

column2: There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
column3: Every raven after his kind;

column2: Nor will they there taste Death, except the first death; and He will preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire,-
column3: Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;

column2: As a Bounty from thy Lord! that will be the supreme achievement!
column3: Three items in the year all thy males shall appear before the LORD God.

column2: Verily, We have made this (Qur'an) easy, in thy tongue, in order that they may give heed.
column3: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.

column2: So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.
column3: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.

column2: Ha-Mim.
column3: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

column2: The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.
column3: This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them.

column2: Verily in the heavens and the earth, are Signs for those who believe.
column3: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

column2: And in the creation of yourselves and the fact that animals are scattered (through the earth), are Signs for those of assured Faith.
column3: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side Jordan near Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

column2: And in the alternation of Night and Day, and the fact that Allah sends down Sustenance from the sky, and revives therewith the earth after its death, and in the change of the winds,- are Signs for those that are wise.
column3: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

column2: Such are the Signs of Allah, which We rehearse to thee in Truth; then in what exposition will they believe after (rejecting) Allah and His Signs?
column3: If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the LORD for a sin offering.

column2: Woe to each sinful dealer in Falsehoods:
